verbLexeme: 1. To make a formal promise, especially a promise to tell the truth in court by swearing on a Bible. English = swear an oath, swear.
2. To take part in a formal ceremony in which you legally become a citizen of a country.
nominalLexeme: 1. A formal promise, especially a promise to tell the truth in court often made by swearing on a Bible. English = oath.
2. Your status as a person who legally belongs to a particular country. English = citizenship.
